programmes.show_description: ...New Year Special: Jimmy Carr hosts as Jon Richardson and Richard Osman take on Johnny Vegas and Sara Pascoe. With David O'Doherty, Joe Wilkinson, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent.
Jimmy Carr hosts as Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan take on Noel Fielding and Fay Ripley. The Brett Domino Trio join Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.
Teleshopping
Teleshopping
The Thomas Shelby Wannabe One: Jane wants a country house wedding extravaganza, but Colm chooses a 1920s-themed reception at a race track featuring gangsters, gambling and the Charleston.
The One with a Christmas Wedding in August: Robbie aims to surprise Jenny with a Christmas wedding in August, featuring reindeer, bridesmaids wearing Santa dresses, and turkey on the menu.
The One with All the Wizards: In Dublin, Harry Potter fan Brendan becomes a wedding wizard, but will his stylish Mexican partner Victor be spellbound by dragons, cauldrons, and broomsticks?
Colie Edison created every element of the bowling giant Bowlero. Now she goes undercover to find out how the brand is working for staff and customers.
Mayor Adrian Perkins of Shreveport, Louisiana, is the city's second youngest mayor and in charge of 3000 employees. He goes undercover, hoping to change the city's fortunes.
In Plymouth, Christine and Kevin serve a menu that even Christine isn't convinced about. Harvey and Natasha throw a Spanish fiesta. And will nerves get the better of Paul and Jo?
Three couples put their hosting skills to the test on Jersey, in a week featuring wedding talk, a chinchilla dinner guest and cocktails from a fake cow...
On Guernsey and Alderney, Sophie and Turk show off the local produce, Dudley and Karla serve an authentic South African feast, and Bobbie and Jamie feel the pressure.
In south London, there are evil glares, a rooftop rave and a cooking meltdown on the hottest day of the year, as three couples compete to host the best dinner party.
Old Neighborhood: Gordon visits Arvada in Colorado, where out-of-control hoarder Randy and his wife Alexa have allowed their restaurant Old Neighborhood to fall into disrepair.
Kati Allo: Gordon's in New York, where the stress of running a Greek restaurant has driven Manny and Christine to the brink of divorce, with their daughter stuck in the middle.
Mangia Mangia (Part 1/2): Gordon visits an Italian restaurant with an identity crisis in Colorado, for the first half of a two-part Nightmare. The owner is at breaking point.
Mangia Mangia (Part 2/2): Gordon returns to Colorado to conclude his attempt to help an Italian restaurant. Can he work his magic on a menu that relies on a microwave?
Zayna Flaming Grill (Part 1/2): Gordon makes the first of two visits to Zayna Flaming Grill, a Mediterranean restaurant in Redondo Beach owned by Faye and her niece Brenda.

programmes.show_name: The Big Fat Quiz of Telly
programmes.show_description: Who shot Mr Burns? What are The Chasers' nicknames? And what's 'The Peppa Effect'? Harry Hill, Judi Love, Tom Allen, Joanne McNally, Sam Campbell and Susan Wokoma take Jimmy Carr's TV test.
Stacey Solomon, Darren Harriott, Thomas Skinner and Sarah Keyworth join host Jimmy Carr and team captains Rob Beckett and Katherine Ryan for more topical comedy.
An extended edition of the show with Jimmy Carr, Sean Lock and Jon Richardson, and their guests, Dr Christian Jessen, Lorraine Kelly, Sarah Millican and Tom Rosenthal.
An extended edition of the show with Jimmy Carr, Sean Lock, Jon Richardson and guests Louie Spence, Joe Wilkinson, Elis James and Shappi Khorsandi tackling the week's hot topics.
Stacey Solomon, Darren Harriott, Thomas Skinner and Sarah Keyworth join host Jimmy Carr and team captains Rob Beckett and Katherine Ryan for more topical comedy.
Teleshopping
Teleshopping
This episode follows Dippin' Dots, which sells cryogenically frozen beads of ice cream. CEO Scott Fischer wants to see if his empire has the manpower to cope with expansion.
Anytime Fitness is a global firm, and it's the job of brand president Stacy Anderson to keep this gym giant in shape. Are all the employees on board with the planned changes?
In London, Elorm and Mimi prepare an Afro-fusion menu. Kiri and Dale serve up the unexpected. And Serge and Eleni's Greek-Cypriot night features their unique food Olympics.
In East Anglia, Chris and Debbie host a night of showbiz glitz and glamour. Jake and Desiree serve up Caribbean cuisine. And can Daisy and Will get through their evening without arguing?
...Selling: Greg and Kristin have no time for house hunting. Cue Jonathan and Drew, whose next mission is to find a six-bedroom home on a restricted budget. Can it be done?
The One in the Spanish Sea: Carl aims to marry Rebecca on the Med but she has expectations for a high-class affair. Will Carl's plans make a splash and make Rebecca swoon with delight?
The One with All the Pigs: Billy believes the sty's the limit as he plans a pig-themed wedding involving a world-record parade of porkers. Will bride Steph kick up a stink at Billy's plans?
Gary Findley, CEO of Restoration 1, a self-described 'Redneck CEO' from Texas, goes undercover to ensure that there are no flaws in the company's playbook.
Paul Damico, the former president and CEO of Round Table Pizza, goes undercover to learn ways to expand the West Coast pizza franchise eastward and attract a younger clientele.
Chappy's: Gordon visits Chappy's in Tennessee, where the chef and owner's careless methods and less-than-appetising food have hurt his restaurant's local reputation.
Amy's Baking Company: At Amy's Baking Company in Scottsdale, Arizona, Gordon Ramsay meets a husband and wife team with a shocking contempt for customer feedback.
...and Selling: Brand new series: Lori's a self-proclaimed hoarder, making her and Michael's property tough to sell. The bros must clear the path to start a cutthroat clean up.
T-Bone with Stakes: Captain Glenn has to act when a guest is injured. And Gary is confused when his advances to Mads aren't reciprocated.
Water, sand and beach balls contribute a seaside feel to this episode, but the jovial tone is soured by one contestant's flagrant cheating.
Jimmy Carr hosts as Jon Richardson and Phil Wang take on guest captain Russell Howard and Roisin Conaty. Nick Helm joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.
Jimmy Carr hosts as Jon Richardson and David O'Doherty take on guest captain Johnny Vegas and Jamie Laing. Holly Walsh joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.
The Girlfriend: Adam finally brings a girlfriend home for dinner, but things get tricky when the family suddenly have to look after eight-year-old Katie, who has a crush on Adam.
The Fox: Dad is secretly keeping a dead fox in the outside freezer because he wants to get it stuffed. But when Mum needs to use the freezer, can he hide the animal from her?
